item.title: Blog - My Favorite Games of 2020
item.description: 2020 was definitely a year, but 2021 is just around the corner. I haven't had the opportunity to do much else other than play games this year which is a silver lining that I don't want to take for granted. I've never before had the time to play as many>>

item.title: Blog - Valve, Steam and You
item.description: If you're a PC gamer in 2020 then chances are that you use Steam as one of your platforms of choice to purchase and play games in. You might not know that Valve, the people behind Steam and many beloved game series such as Half Life, Portal, Left 4>>

item.title: Blog - Ready, Set, VR?
item.description: Virtual reality. You have to try it to believe it. It's unlike anything I've ever experienced and I think that everyone should get a chance to put a headset on. Modern VR headsets have been out in the wild for a little more than half a decade and yet>>

item.title: Blog - Moving out, Growing In
item.description:
Moving out of my childhood home to live on my own was tough. I realized this as I rolled out of the U-Haul truck with a piece of toast in one hand and my hopes and dreams in the other.
I moved out of my family's place a little more than a year ago>>

item.title: Blog - Chronic Pain and HUGE Trackballs
item.description: blockquote> WARNING: If you've got pain in your body, listen to it. If you're a big Gamer, please take breaks and play responsibly. Video games are wonderful but they aren't worth destroying your mind and body over playing them, or making them. You'll thank>> blockquote>

item.title: Blog - Baby's First 3D Models for Printing
item.description:
I've been thinking of buying a 3D printer…
It's something I've always been interested in but until recently I haven't had the space for it. The consumer 3D printing world has gotten a lot cheaper and simpler to get into in recent years.
In preparation>>

item.title: Blog - Power Fantasies, Environments and Legend of Grimrock 2
item.description: The world around us is mysterious, magnificent and beautiful. It’s a living breathing ecosystem with an internal logic of its own. Mother Nature, and Father Concrete, represent the interwoven complexity held within the environments that we live in and>>

item.title: Blog - The Second Coming of Rust
item.description:
In these UNCERTAIN TIMES, I've found myself with a little more free time than usual because I haven't needed to commute to an office every day. I've tried to funnel that energy into creative and constructive hobbies. Keyword: em>triedem>.
In the past week>>

item.title: Blog - Favorite games of the past, present and future
item.description:
Hello fellow human.
I've been quite busy this week, I've been focusing a lot of my free time on modding, making changes to an existing game, of a newly released game which I've been pouring a lot of time into given how good it is (I'll mention it later>>

item.title: Blog - Hunt, Showdown, Repeat
item.description: You are a bounty hunter dredging through demon-infested Louisiana swamps in an alternate timeline of our 1895 but with some anachronisms thrown in. You need to find, then kill a demonic monster and, finally, leave the swamp as quickly as you can. Problem>>

item.title: Blog - A Gamer's Guide to: Cheating in Single-Player Games
item.description: Welcome to my second "A Gamer's Guide to" blog post (check out my a href="../../../../blog/2020-08-22/">previous one on online multiplayer video gamesa>). I'll be explaining how you can cheat in single-player games on PC. If you're feeling like a rebel then take a seat and prepare to bask>>

item.title: Blog - A Gamer's Guide to: Online Multiplayer
item.description:
Welcome to my first "A Gamer's Guide to…". This series of articles will cover a wide range of topics of interest to gamers from the perspective of a video game programmer.
I know a little about what goes into making a video game. I gained a wide breadth>>

item.title: Blog - You can always reload, until you can't
item.description: Most games don't matter. The actions you play out within most games don't have any long term impact on you as a player. Some narrative games imply that the choices you make have an impact on the world but given that the world is imaginary, does it really>>

item.title: Blog - Interviews - The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
item.description: Looking for a job sucks. A couple of months ago, I was going through interview after interview like a wrecking ball blasting through concrete. No buildings were destroyed in the process but I may have burned some bridges along the way. We laughed, we>>

item.title: Blog - My Game of the Year List for 2019
item.description:
I love video games. I've loved them almost my entire life. I loved them enough to make making them my job. I'm not working in video game development anymore but I still enjoy playing games and pondering over them.
Here's a list of the video games I>>

item.title: Blog - Warhammer 40k - a Blast from the Past
item.description:
I recently dove head first into the world of Warhammer 40k. A dark and edgy tabletop game born in the 80s played with many miniature models of science fiction soldiers, aliens, etc.
If you've heard of space orks (generic fantasy orcs thrust forty thousand>>

item.title: Blog - Code review on an 8 year old project
item.description: One of the first projects I worked on after learning how to program, around 8 years ago, is called a href="https://github.com/KeikakuB/writerator/tree/legacy">writeratora>. It is a Python command line interface (or CLI for short) for analyzing English language text and generating randomized poetry such as haikus>>

item.title: Blog - Building a website for 17$ or less
item.description:
The website you're reading this on was built by myself and it cost me a total of 17$ CDN (yearly). Without a custom domain it would have cost me nothing, zilch, nada.
My goal for this website was to create my own space on the internet to allow me to>>

item.title: Blog - Influencing the odds inside and outside of Blood Bowl 2
item.description:
"Blood Bowl 2 smashes Warhammer and American football together, in an explosive cocktail of turn-based strategy, humour and brutality, adapted from Games Workshop's famous board game."
I'd be hard pressed to come up with a better brief description>>

item.title: Blog - The website, Mortal Kombat 11 and microtransactions
item.description: I'm currently working on my website (the one you're currently on, I should probably put a "work-in-progress" sign up…). Work has been going well so far. I had done most of the 'setting everything up' for the site a year and a half ago before I was employed>>
